is a township in the Cuddalore District of

By Road: Neyveli Township is located at about 200 KM South-West of Chennai (the state capital of Tamilnadu, India). Neyveli is well connected by Road from Chennai. The place is located on the highway to Tanjore from Chennai at about 24th KM from Panruti. There are frequent bus services available and journey time is about 4 1/2 to 5 hours. 

By Rail: Travelling upto Villupuram (which is about 50 KM from Neyveli) on the main line (Chennai - Trichy) by train from Chennai and taking up bus to reach Neyveli. Frequent bus services are available from Villupuram to Neyveli.

Travelling upto Vridachalam from Chennai / Trichy by train and from there taking a bus to Neyveli. The distance from Vridachalam to Neyveli township is about 30 KM.

The soils of Neyveli and the region surrounding are stuffed with rich reserves of Lignite underneath. They serve as fuel to feed the Thermal power stations constructed there. In all there are three lignite mines (Mine-I, Mine-IA, Mine-II ) and three thermal power stations (Thermal Station(TS) -I, TS-I expansion and TS-II).

Hotel Blue Diamend located in Main bazaar is good for nice vegetarian meals.

Neyveli Township have lot of hotels. Hotel Radha is a star hotel near bus stand. Hotel Swarnabawan located inside the bus stand is nice and cheap.


Hotel Krishna - Rooms available, with attached bar/restaurant with vegetarian and non-vegetarian food.
